author: gballet
content:
I have taken the time to go over all the writeups for the merge that I am aware of. Is there an option that doesn't require maiming the consensus on the eth1 side?
We could have a hard fork, where we just say: "eth2 is trailing eth1 by `N` blocks, and a hard fork will occur at block height `h`. The `h+N` blocks of eth1 are considered non-canon, although block producers will strive to replay txs in the `[h;h+N]` range.
What I would like to ensure is that if a problem occurs during the transition, we want to be able to fall back to a functioning main chain and try again.
